terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Arizona mountains. Significant elevation with mountain scenery at altitude.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Local Arizona event. Mountain terrain with good access, moderate costs, altitude, and small local field.

biased_opinion.summary: Bear Howard Gravel is a local event in Arizona—mountain terrain with significant elevation at altitude. The Arizona mountains are scenic, but the small local field and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid local Arizona mountain gravel race. Worth it for Arizona/Southwest riders. Not worth traveling for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to Arizona—yes, it's solid. If you're traveling—skip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Arizona races: Whiskey Off-Road, Chino Grinder.

logistics.food: Flagstaff has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Local event with mountainous terrain at altitude.

logistics.explanation: Friday packet pickup at SOSTA restaurant comes with a warning: "Please be aware there are very few parking spaces in the parking lot but along San Francisco, Leroux, Dale and Elm." Race morning pickup runs 5:30-7:15am at Flagstaff High School for a 6:30am start. Limited to 200 participants keeps chaos manageable.

length.explanation: 60 miles delivers "2,800 ft of climbing" staying "west of the peaks" with fast times "just over 3 hours" and mid-pack "around the 4 hour mark." Quinn Travis won in 2:59:36, proving the distance hits the sweet spot. 100-mile option adds Saddle Mountain suffering for the committed. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Organizers warn the 100-mile "will test your bike handling as well as your fitness" with "a few sections of technical gravel." The course includes "a cool section of single track" and is "mostly gravel" with minimal asphalt. They emphasize it's "challenging in its features" beyond just distance. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds.

elevation.explanation: The 100-mile delivers "just over 6k of total elevation gain" including the "challenging out and back climb up Saddle Mountain" with a $250 Strava prize. Organizers get feedback that the course is "epic and certainly no walk in the park." 60-mile riders face 2,800 feet of climbing west of the peaks. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds.

climate.explanation: August start times are staggered from 6:30am for the 100-mile through 8:15am for the 30-mile, getting riders moving before Flagstaff heat peaks. High-altitude location moderates summer temperatures compared to lower Arizona deserts. Morning starts avoid afternoon thunderstorm potential. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL. As From event organizer puts it: "Flagstaff is pretty nice in August. But at 7,000 ft **sun screen will be key**. While on course you may experience our **infamous monsoons**, so maybe a light rain jacket but often temperatures are pl..."

altitude.explanation: Flagstaff's 7,000+ foot elevation hits every rider from the start line, making climbs hurt more than the profile suggests. Organizers emphasize the 100-mile "should not be underestimated" partly due to altitude effects on performance. Thin air makes recovery slower throughout the ride. Similar altitude considerations to Grinduro.

adventure.explanation: Race finishes at Lowell Observatory which "has just completed a state of the art observatory and visitors center" with Bear Howard discounts. Coconino National Forest setting delivers on the promise to "leave you feeling legendary (if only in your own mind)" in the shadow of Flagstaff's peaks.

prestige.explanation: Fifth-year event organized by Sable Events caps at 200 riders. Winners include Kyle Trudeau (5:07:19 in 2022) and Tyler Arnett (5:30:52 in 2024), but no major pro field depth or national attention. Named after 1882 railroad brawler Bear Howard for Wild West storytelling appeal.

race_quality.explanation: Course is "fully marked with large green and yellow signs at every turn" with GPS files available. Aid stations provide "neutral water, nutrition and snacks" though organizers warn those with dietary restrictions to "pack enough food on your bike for the entire ride." Three distance options with proper support.

experience.explanation: Primary rule is "DON'T BE A JERK" with emphasis on being kind to volunteers who "are not your personal mechanic." Finish party at Lowell Observatory includes "race number, socks, finishers glass, and Awards." Stories "will be exaggerated and inflated, fueled by whiskey and grandeur."

community.explanation: Sable Events promotes gravel racing as "more than just a sport – it's a community" fostering "a welcoming and inclusive environment." DNF policy is supportive: "That's okay, there is always next year and now you know what to expect!" 200-rider cap maintains intimate atmosphere.

field_depth.explanation: 200-rider cap limits competitive depth. 2024 60-mile winner Quinn Travis finished in 2:59:36 with David Rakestraw close at 2:59:43, suggesting decent local competition. 100-mile times range 5:07-5:30 for winners with mid-pack finishing 6:00-7:00 hours. Regional Arizona field without national draw. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Three distance options from 30-100 miles with aid stations, course marking, GPS files, and finish party at Lowell Observatory. Includes race swag and observatory discount for families. Coconino National Forest access and Grand Canyon proximity (1.5 hours) extend weekend destination value.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $75-100. Flagstaff lodging runs expensive during August tourist season with limited budget options. Parking challenges at packet pickup location require street parking along San Francisco, Leroux, Dale and Elm streets. High-altitude mountain town costs more than expected for food and accommodation. Higher total cost than Badlands.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: IRC Boken Double Cross
primary.why: Underrated mixed-terrain tire. Fast center with confident shoulder grip.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners
